intro: Canthium clityophyllum, commonly known as the golden star sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars, typically blooming in clusters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Canthium clityophyllum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
